DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine Transcutaneous Sacral Nerve Stimulation ( TENS SNS ) effective Percutaneous Tibial Nerve Stimulation ( PTNS ) therapeutic option subject Idiopathic Overactive Bladder ( OAB ) fail conventional therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Transcutaneous Percutaneous PTNS Idiopathic OAB
DOC.detailed_description: Both therapy proven effective , time compare . PTNS TENS SNS proven effective modify bladder diary score ( change frequency day night urination , urge incontinence ) , improve subject 's quality life . Only PTNS show change urodynamic data undergo therapy . The investigator hypothesize short-term effectiveness benefit report , least equal TENS group , compare therapy randomize control trial . Secondary goal evaluate change bladder diary score ( frequency urination , nocturia , urgency leakage episode ) , participant quality life improvement score , change detrusor instability , change urodynamic data undergo therapy .
DOC.criteria: Female male Age > 18 year Complaint urge urinary incontinence ( 3 episode per week ) OR overactive bladder ( 8 void per day , and/or 2 void per night ) Urodynamic data overactive detrusor Failed trial conservative therapy ( bladder training , fluid modification , diet modification , caffeine restriction , pelvic floor training ) Failed trial anticholinergic either due inability take medication , adverse reaction medication , improvement medication Willing complete study questionnaire inform consent study Presence bladder obstruction ( prostate prolapse ) Neurogenic bladder overactivity Previous pelvic organ prolapse surgery Unwilling mentally incompetent participate study Pregnancy plan become pregnant study Presence urinary fistula Recurrent current urinary tract infection ( 5 infection last 12 month ) Bladder stone Bladder cancer suspect bladder cancer Hematuria Central peripheral neurologic disorder Multiple Sclerosis , Parkinson 's disease , spina bifida , spinal cord lesion Metal implant pacemaker , implantable defibrillator , metal implant PTNS TENS device need place ( sacrum ankle/leg ) .
